Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. With five line Kufic inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4134 and OA+ 4336.This very common die appears to be the only quarter- qisṭ which has the name of ʿUbaydāllāh b. al-Ḥabḥāb alone. On his second type, represented by OA+ 4019, the name of a subordinate official, Junāda b. Maysara, also appears. The second type is dated AH 111 and presumably the type with ʿUbaydāllāh alone was in use in the earlier part of his governorship - another case which gives reason to think that under ʿUbaydāllāh, in many cases, legends beginning ‘mimmā amara bihi’ are earlier than those beginning bismillāh.

From the same die: Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London,105-6; Launois, Aimée. 1957.
